Package moulton.scalable.containers

Interface Container

public interface Container
The container of the menu. This class is usually responsible to handle any mousePress, mouseRelease, mouseMoved, keyPressed, and keyTyped methods and pass them to the menus in use. This can easily be achieved with mouse and key listeners.
Author:
Matthew Moulton

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getMenuHeight()  
    int getMenuWidth()  
    void setCursor​(int cursorType)
    This method is responsible for setting the cursor of the menu to the specified type.

  • Method Details

    • getMenuWidth

      int getMenuWidth()
      Returns:
      the width, in pixels, the menu should fill

    • getMenuHeight

      int getMenuHeight()
      Returns:
      the height, in pixels, the menu should fill

    • setCursor

      void setCursor​(int cursorType)
      This method is responsible for setting the cursor of the menu to the specified type. If the container is implemented by a JFrame or a JPanel, this method can be achieved by calling:
      yourComp.setCursor(Cursor.getPredefinedCursor(cursorType));

      Due to the minimalistic policy of Moulton Scalable Menus, only touch responsive components added to MenuManager.touchCheckList will be queried for cursor updates.

      Parameters:
      cursorType - the type of cursor as specified by Cursor
      See Also:
      Component.setCursor(Cursor)
